availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
Jany 11.
The Governor approved the following accounts to the City of Frankfort for gas for the month of January
Also an account of $1.00. to James Penn for packing public books in State Arsenal
Also account of $4.60 to Frank Nolls for painting and glazing done in State Capitol.
And account of $6.90 to Nancy Morton for washing &c done at Auditors' office, certified as correct by the Assistant Auditor.
He commissioned Jno. L. Phythian Assistant Surgeon in Ky State Guard
And Tho. G. Calvert 2d Lieutenant in the State Guard
Also R. W. Woolley 1st Lieutenant in the Lexington Rifles, duly elected.
